userPromptEntries.prompt: The user's current OS is: Linux I am working in a workspace with the following folders: - /home/pb/code/tech-demos I am working in a workspace that has the following structure: ``` ``` This is the state of the context at this point in the conversation. The view of the workspace structure may be truncated. You can use tools to collect more context if needed. [Chronological Review: Walk through conversation phases: initial request → exploration → implementation → debugging → current state] - Phase 1 (Scaffold + tooling): User asked for a React site deployable to GitHub Pages with modern build tools. The project was scaffolded with Vite + React, then migrated to TypeScript. Legacy `.jsx` files were removed. ESLint + Prettier were added with modern TypeScript/React rules and scripts (`lint`, `lint:fix`). - Phase 2 (Portfolio + 3D hero): Built a portfolio homepage for a backend dev with a React Three Fiber scene: rotating rounded cube, glass-like material, environment lighting, and an in-canvas slider controlling glass transmission. Hash routing was used for GitHub Pages compatibility. - Phase 3 (Interactivity + icons): Reworked cube face navigation to in-scene meshes; added hover cursor, press-in animation, selection glow, external “Selected skill” panel, and improved skill icons to be flatter. Iterated on GraphQL and Kubernetes icons, fixing clickability issues by geometry/material adjustments and face rotation corrections. - Phase 4 (GitHub Pages deployment): Switched to branch deployment via `docs/` output and ensured assets load correctly with proper base paths and `.nojekyll`. - Phase 5 (Prompt logging + viewer): User requested logging “all user inputs” into JSON and a viewer page. Implemented an append-only JSON log, created a dedicated viewer route/page, added UI polish and search, and added “Copilot instructions” + a helper script to append new prompts. - Phase 6 (Full transcript backfill): User insisted “whole prompt” history exists “in the chat”; user provided a `full-chat` file. The agent parsed it and backfilled the JSON log with verbatim prompts. - Phase 7 (Refactor modules): User requested `src/pages` sibling to `src/components` and `src/data` for data files; moved page components and data accordingly, updated imports/scripts, and verified build. - Phase 8 (Build warning fix): User requested fixing Vite’s CJS Node API deprecation warning and chunk-size warnings; config was adjusted and renamed so builds are clean. - Phase 9 (Current work): User requested richer project detail pages (tech used, learnings, screenshot, live link) and also asked for a future “copilot skill” that clones/scans repos. The agent began implementing the data model and Project details UI. [Intent Mapping: List each explicit user request with message context] - “start creating a website…deploy to github pages…react app…basic and modern build tools” - “make it typescript” + remove leftover `.jsx` - “add a linter that’s super modern…Add lint and lint:fix scripts” - “create a really cool portfolio…react-three-fiber…rotating cube” - “semi-transparent…realistic glass…add a slider in the threejs canvas” - “create a linked in widget…profile image…background image” - “extract all components into their own components module” - “make icons flatter…fix GraphQL…do the same for Kubernetes” - “add text under each icon…only show when cube face is most prominently facing camera…fade in/out” - “put all user inputs into a json…new page ‘Generated with Agent Prompts’…append on new prompts (add instructions)” - “viewer nicer…professional…modern…easily searchable…show whole prompt” - “create pages module sibling of components…data module…move profile.ts etc” - “Fix this warning: Vite CJS Node API deprecated…chunk warnings” - “project details page: tech used, learnings, screenshot, live link” - “new copilot skill: clone repo to temp dir and scan/extract project info” [Technical Inventory: Catalog all technologies, patterns, and decisions mentioned] - Frontend: Vite v5, React 18, TypeScript. - Linting: ESLint + Prettier with modern TS/React rules; `lint` and `lint:fix`. - 3D: three.js, @react-three/fiber, @react-three/drei (RoundedBox, Environment, OrbitControls, Text, Html, Edges, useCursor). - Routing: `react-router-dom` with `HashRouter` for GitHub Pages. - Deployment: GitHub Pages branch deploy from `docs/`, `.nojekyll` postbuild. - Prompt logging system: - Append-only JSON log of user prompts (verbatim), timestamps, optional summary and files. - Viewer page with search/filtering, left list + detail panel, copy-to-clipboard. - Helper script to append log entries and avoid duplicates. - Repository instructions file requiring future prompt logging. - Build warning mitigation: - Vite config converted/treated as ESM by renaming to `.mjs`. - Increased chunk size warning threshold in Vite build config. [Code Archaeology: Document every file, function, and code change discussed] Key files impacted over the session (high level): - `src/components/CubeHeroScene.tsx`: R3F hero scene; cube faces; pointer events; hit-plane; press-in animation; label visibility based on face normal vs camera; smooth fade via per-label opacity damping. - `src/SkillMark3D.tsx`: Flat-ish icon glyphs; GraphQL and Kubernetes refined; materials fixed to avoid reuse issues; ensured no protruding geometry; ring geometry changes. - `src/pages/HomePage.tsx`: Portfolio hero layout; LinkedIn widget; projects list; links to Agent Prompts page. - `src/pages/AgentPromptsPage.tsx`: Modern prompt viewer; left preview + right detail; search; copy; back-to-home navigation. - `src/pages/ProjectPage.tsx`: Project detail view; recently enhanced to include screenshot, tech used, learnings, and live link (conditional rendering). - `src/data/profile.ts`, `src/data/projects.ts`, `src/data/agent-prompts.json`: Data moved into `src/data`; `projects.ts` type extended to include `liveUrl`, `screenshotUrl`, `techUsed`, `whatILearned`. - `src/App.tsx`: Routes updated to use `src/pages/*`. - `src/index.css`: Added styles for prompt viewer (toolbar/layout/list/detail); added styles for project screenshot/chips/list; integrated with existing site design language. - `scripts/append-agent-prompt.cjs`: Helper script updated to append structured entries and (after refactor) write to `src/data/agent-prompts.json`; includes duplicate-prevention logic. - `.github/copilot-instructions.md`: Instructions requiring appending verbatim prompts to the log; updated after moving log to `src/data`. - `vite.config.mjs`: Renamed from `.js` to `.mjs` to avoid deprecated CJS loading warning; build config includes outDir `docs/` and `chunkSizeWarningLimit`. - `full-chat` (repo file): Provided by user; parsed to backfill prompt log with verbatim user prompts. [Progress Assessment: What's done vs. pending with specific status] Done: - Portfolio site baseline and Pages deployment setup. - 3D cube hero with glass slider, interactive icons, labels that appear on most-facing face with fade. - Prompt logging system: JSON log, modern searchable viewer, append script, and instructions; backfilled from `full-chat`. - Refactor: created `src/pages` and `src/data`, moved files and updated imports. - Build warning fix: removed Vite CJS Node API warning; silenced chunk warning. In progress / pending: - Project details enrichment: Data model extended and ProjectPage updated to render richer fields; existing `projects` entries still need to be populated with tech/learnings/screenshot/live link. - “Copilot skill” request: a repo-scanning capability that clones a GitHub repo to a temp dir and extracts project info is not yet implemented (only discussed as the next planned piece). Needs design: clone strategy, extraction heuristics (README parsing, package.json, tech detection), and output format for `src/data/projects.ts`. [Context Validation: Verify all critical information for continuation is captured] - The project uses HashRouter and builds to `docs/` for GitHub Pages. - Prompt log is now located at `src/data/agent-prompts.json` and should be appended for every new prompt using the helper script (or manual edits). - Project detail page supports the new fields but data population and automation (repo scan) remain. - Build output should now be free of the CJS deprecation warning because Vite config is `.mjs`. [Recent Commands Analysis: Last agent commands executed, tool results (truncated if long), immediate pre-summarization state] Most recent operations (the ones immediately preceding this summarization request): 1) Read current project data + project detail page: - Opened `src/data/projects.ts` and `src/pages/ProjectPage.tsx` to assess current schema and render. - Found `Project` only had `slug`, `name`, `description`, optional `githubUrl`, `tags`, and ProjectPage only rendered title/desc/tags/GitHub link. 2) Applied edits to implement richer project details: - Updated `src/data/projects.ts`: - Added optional fields: `liveUrl`, `screenshotUrl`, `techUsed`, `whatILearned`. - Updated `src/pages/ProjectPage.tsx`: - Added “View Live App” CTA when `liveUrl` exists. - Added conditional sections: - Screenshot section rendering `` when `screenshotUrl` exists. - “Tech used” chips when `techUsed` exists. - “What I learned” bullet list when `whatILearned` exists. - Updated `src/index.css`: - Added `.projectScreenshot`, `.projectChips`, `.projectChip`, `.projectList` styles. 3) Immediate state at token-pressure point: - The agent had just completed the initial implementation for richer project detail rendering and styling. - The next planned work (not yet executed) was to implement the “repo scanner” capability (clone to temp directory, scan for tech/README links, generate structured data), and to populate real project entries with these new fields. Connection to overall user goals: - These edits directly address the user’s request to make the project detail page more informative (tech stack, learnings, screenshot, live link) and set up the schema needed for an automated repo-scanning tool to fill in those fields later. 1. Conversation Overview: - Primary Objectives: - “I want to start creating a website that I can deploy to github pages…react app…modern build tools” - “Yep, let’s make it typescript” / remove `.jsx` - “add a linter that’s super modern…Add lint and lint:fix scripts” - “create a really cool portfolio…react-three-fiber…rotating cube” - “make it semi-transparent like super realistic glass…add a slider” - “create a linked in widget…profile image…background image” - “do a pass on the icons…more flat…fix GraphQL…Kubernetes” - “add text underneith each icon…only show…fade in/out” - “put all of the user inputs…in a json…Generated with Agent Prompts…append…instructions” - “Create a new pages module…data module…move profile.ts…” - “Fix this warning…Vite CJS Node API is deprecated…” - “For the project details page I want a bunch more info…tech…what I learned…screenshot…live link…” - “create a new copilot skill that clones the git repo…scans…extracts project info” - Session Context: - Built and polished a GitHub Pages-deployed portfolio with a glassy 3D cube hero and interactive skill icons; added a prompt log + searchable viewer; refactored folder structure into pages/data; fixed build warnings; began enriching the project details page schema/UI. - User Intent Evolution: - Tooling + deployment → 3D portfolio experience → icon/UX polish → deployment fixes → prompt auditability and professional viewer → repo structure refactor → build warning cleanup → richer project detail pages + automated repo scanning. 2. Codebase Status (recently touched): - `src/data/projects.ts` - Purpose: Project data backing the Projects list and details pages. - Current State: Extended `Project` type with `liveUrl`, `screenshotUrl`, `techUsed`, `whatILearned`. - `src/pages/ProjectPage.tsx` - Purpose: Project detail page. - Current State: Now renders “View Live App”, screenshot, tech chips, and “What I learned” list when present. - `src/index.css` - Purpose: Global styling. - Current State: Added project detail styles (screenshot + chips + list). - Pending schema population: Existing project entries still need to be populated with the new fields. 4. - Phase 2 (3D hero + UI polish): Built a homepage with a React Three Fiber “glass cube” hero (with a transmission slider), improved navigation/interaction, and iterated on visuals.
- Phase 3 (Prompt logging + viewer): Implemented append-only logging of user prompts into `src/data/agent-prompts.json` and a searchable “Agent Prompts” viewer route/page; backfilled from a “full-chat” transcript.
- Phase 4 (Projects enrichment + automation): Extended the `Project` model and `ProjectPage` to support richer details (live links, screenshots, tech used, learnings, highlights). Packaged the “document a project” workflow into an Agent Skill under `.github/skills/project-documentation/` and built Node scripts to scan repos and auto-update `src/data/projects.ts`, including screenshot copying.
- Phase 5 (More projects + better detection): Added personal projects #2 and #3 from GitHub repos, improved README parsing and tech detection (Docker, Docker Compose, Postgres, Ollama, AWS Bedrock; including lockfile-based detection).
- Phase 6 (Work projects section + public-site screenshots): Added “Work Projects” as a separate data section and updated routing/lookups to support work project detail pages. Implemented a Playwright-based workflow to load public sites, auto-dismiss cookie/consent modals (including TrustArc), wait before capture, and generate both viewport and full-page screenshots. Used this to document EA store pages (Skate, Battlefield, Apex).
- Phase 7 (GH Pages workflow fixes): Updated GitHub Actions workflow versions to avoid deprecated artifact actions and later addressed (or prepared to address) deploy-pages v4 environment requirement.

  - Check the personal project cards on the landing page to ensure description/tags wrap as desired and no overflow occurs at narrow widths.
- Pending Task 2: Commit/push cleanly for GH Pages
  - Stage `src/` changes + `public/` screenshots + `docs/` output, then commit and push.
- Next Action:
  - If any remaining truncation appears, adjust thumbnail width and/or introduce a “2-line title clamp” while leaving description fully readable.

</summary>
</conversation-summary>
userPromptEntries.summary: Recorded environment info + conversation summary context.

userPromptEntries.prompt: The image should be a square in the personal project tile
userPromptEntries.summary: Updated Personal Projects row-card thumbnail CSS to enforce a square (1:1) image.

userPromptEntries.prompt: There's a weird shadown or something with the selected state in the cube when the skill is selected
userPromptEntries.summary: Switched skill icon meshes to an unlit material to remove lighting/shadow artifacts when a skill is selected.

userPromptEntries.prompt: That shadow thing is still showing
userPromptEntries.summary: Adjusted cube skill mark press animation to move outward (not into the glass cube) to avoid shadow/refraction artifacts.

userPromptEntries.prompt: It just shows for the icon shape when selected, the text label and cube side itself are fine
userPromptEntries.summary: Adjusted selected skill icon material to disable depth testing (and disable depth write) so the active icon renders cleanly without glass depth artifacts.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Now the icons can no longer be seen at all
userPromptEntries.summary: Fixed selected icon rendering so it stays visible over the glass cube by drawing the active icon as a transparent, high-renderOrder overlay (avoids depth artifacts).

userPromptEntries.prompt: I still can't see the icons
userPromptEntries.summary: Fixed cube/icon render ordering by preventing the glass cube from writing depth and ensuring icons render after the cube.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Icons are still not showing
userPromptEntries.summary: Made skill icon materials transparent (opacity 1) and increased renderOrder so they render after the transparent glass cube.

userPromptEntries.prompt: The icons are visible through the cube even when it's set to non-transparent (0% glass), but I only want them to be shown when the cube side is visible
userPromptEntries.summary: Hide skill icon groups on back-facing cube sides (so they never show through the cube) and make the cube truly opaque at 0% glass by toggling its material transparency based on transmission.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Now that weird shadow/reflection on the selected icon is back
userPromptEntries.summary: Render only the selected icon as a high-renderOrder overlay (but only when the cube is in glass mode) to avoid refraction/shadow artifacts while keeping normal face-visibility rules.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Looks great, but the glass slider no longer works
userPromptEntries.summary: Fixed the glass slider range so it can reach 0% (opaque) again by setting min=0, restoring expected behavior.

userPromptEntries.prompt: The slider no longer changes the transparency of the cube
userPromptEntries.summary: Restored visible cube transparency changes by mapping transmission to material opacity (while retaining MeshPhysicalMaterial transmission for the glass look).

userPromptEntries.prompt: Remove the glass slider completely
userPromptEntries.summary: Removed the glass slider UI and related state/props; the cube now uses a fixed transmission value.

userPromptEntries.prompt: I want fully opaque
userPromptEntries.summary: Set the cube to be permanently opaque by fixing transmission to 0 and using an opaque material (no transparency/opacity mapping).

userPromptEntries.prompt: If I click and hold the icon it should stay indented
userPromptEntries.summary: Changed cube face icon press animation to be hold-to-indent by damping toward a pressed target and releasing on global pointerup/cancel.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Can you ensure that the text below the icon is always at the bottom of the cube based on the current camera view and viewport so that it's always easy to read
userPromptEntries.summary: Replaced rotating 3D face labels with a fixed screen-space label pinned to the bottom of the cube viewport for consistent readability.

userPromptEntries.prompt: That's not right, I still want the text to be rendered on the cube, but just the side of the cube that's closest to the ground (bottom of the viewport)
userPromptEntries.summary: Switched cube label back to 3D Text and render it only on the bottom-most visible face in the current camera view; removed prior screen-space Html label.

userPromptEntries.prompt: It's still sometimes showing on top
userPromptEntries.summary: Adjusted cube label placement logic to choose the bottom-most face in screen-space using the projected label anchor point, reducing cases where the label appears on the top.

userPromptEntries.prompt: It should show the face that's currently in view (current behavior, but the label should always be as low as possible)
userPromptEntries.summary: Fixed bottom-face label selection to project the label's true world position (including the icon group's z-offset) so the chosen visible face is consistently the lowest in the viewport.

userPromptEntries.prompt: It's still showing on top sometimes, but it's mostly good now
userPromptEntries.summary: Made bottom-face label selection more stable by projecting the label via markGroup (includes press offsets), ignoring offscreen/behind-camera candidates, relaxing label-facing threshold to >0, and adding small hysteresis to prevent occasional flips to a higher face.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Looks great, can you make the cube look even more impressive
userPromptEntries.summary: Enhanced cube visuals with shadows + subtle float motion and improved physical material highlights (clearcoat/emissive/env intensity), plus a stronger shadow-casting key light.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Sure, I want it to look super impressive
userPromptEntries.summary: Upgraded cube visuals with studio-style Environment Lightformers, extra rim/key lights, and richer physical material tuning (more premium highlights + shadow presence) without changing UX.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Anything else like cube maps or radiosity tracing that can make it look even better?
userPromptEntries.summary: Logged discussion of further rendering upgrades (HDRI cubemaps, dynamic envmaps, GI/path tracing approximations) and offered next-step options.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Super impressive without perf risk and any deps needed
userPromptEntries.summary: Upgraded cube grounding with drei AccumulativeShadows + RandomizedLight for high-end soft shadows (no new dependencies), keeping the existing studio Environment/lighting.

userPromptEntries.prompt: That bottom floor looks bad, more glossy
userPromptEntries.summary: Added a subtle reflective ground plane (MeshReflectorMaterial) and softened/lifted AccumulativeShadows so the base looks cleaner and glossier.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Sometimes the floor looks really bad, and feel free to add more dependencies to make it look photo realistic or even better looking
userPromptEntries.summary: Installed @react-three/postprocessing (fiber v8 compatible) and switched the hero to a postprocessing-based photoreal pass (SSAO + subtle bloom + vignette + filmic tonemapping) while replacing the artifact-prone reflective floor with stable contact shadows.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Find a small (1k) CC0-licensed HDRI from Poly Haven with a direct .hdr download URL. Return: (1) asset name, (2) direct URL to the 1k .hdr file, (3) expected file size if available, (4) any required attribution/license notes (should be CC0).
userPromptEntries.summary: Identified Poly Haven HDRI 'Plains Sunset' and extracted the direct 1k .hdr download URL and file size; confirmed CC0 license notes.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Sure, go for it
userPromptEntries.summary: Added a real CC0 HDRI environment (Poly Haven plains_sunset_1k.hdr) and wired it into the cube hero via drei Environment(files=...) using Vite BASE_URL, improving reflections/lighting realism.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Remove the hdri stuff as it looks pretty much the same
userPromptEntries.summary: Removed the external HDRI environment file and switched back to the built-in studio Lightformer Environment setup.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Sure, tune the cube to look better
userPromptEntries.summary: Tuned cube hero for a glossier, cleaner premium look by adjusting studio Lightformer intensities, filmic exposure, SSAO/Bloom/Vignette settings, contact shadow softness, and cube material reflectivity.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Looks good, now make it so clicking and dragging the cube scene will rotate the cube instead of rotating the scene and keep the floor on the ground and the camera fixed
userPromptEntries.summary: Replaced OrbitControls (camera rotation) with object-based drag rotation via drei PresentationControls; disabled cube auto-rotation so dragging rotates the cube while camera/ground remain fixed.

userPromptEntries.prompt: The rotating of the cube doesn't match the direction I'm clicking and dragging
userPromptEntries.summary: Replaced PresentationControls with a custom grab-and-drag object rotator so cube rotation matches pointer direction; moved skill click/hover handlers to the icon group so dragging on the cube rotates instead of selecting.

userPromptEntries.prompt: That's good, but I still want inertia
userPromptEntries.summary: Added inertial cube rotation: track angular velocity during drag and apply damped rotation after release, keeping camera and ground fixed.

userPromptEntries.prompt:

userPromptEntries.summary: Fixed HeroScene runtime crash caused by calling useFrame outside the Canvas context by moving drag/inertia logic into a Canvas child component (DragRotateGroup) and removing a duplicate/incorrect HeroScene export that appeared during refactor.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Reduce the friction a bit more, I want it to keep spinning for a couple of seconds at least
userPromptEntries.summary: Reduced inertia damping on the drag-rotated cube so it coasts longer after release.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Under the "Selected Skill" section add a new cool looking gauge component that shows how many years I've had experience with that skill and add a small description of what that skill entails
userPromptEntries.summary: Added a compact experience gauge + per-skill description under the Selected skill panel on the home page, driven by a skillDetailsByKind map (years editable).

userPromptEntries.prompt: Looks great, fix this one last bug\nPlease enable the NormalPass in the EffectComposer in order to use SSAO.
userPromptEntries.summary: Enabled EffectComposer NormalPass (enableNormalPass) so SSAO has a normal buffer and stops warning/crashing.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Make the cube skill icon click area larger
userPromptEntries.summary: Increased cube skill icon click target by adding an invisible hit plane behind each skill mark.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Any click and drag in the canvas should rotate the cube, it doesn't need to be on the cube itself
userPromptEntries.summary: Added a large invisible background hit plane and refactored DragRotateGroup so drags anywhere in the canvas rotate the cube (icon clicks still stop propagation).

userPromptEntries.prompt: Make it so clicking anywhere even the icon will still rotate
userPromptEntries.summary: Changed icon interaction so pointer-down on icons no longer blocks drag rotation; selection now occurs on pointer-up only when no drag movement happened.

userPromptEntries.prompt: The content is shifting quite a bit after selecting a skill, ensure that doesn't happen
userPromptEntries.summary: Prevented layout shift in the Selected skill panel by always rendering the gauge/description area with reserved min-height; hide it visually until a skill is selected and clamp description height.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Rotating of the cube itself isn't working well, go back to the original default behaviour to rotate the scene/camera instead and remove the floor
userPromptEntries.summary: Reverted cube interaction to camera/scene orbit controls (OrbitControls) instead of object-rotation drag, and removed the floor/contact shadow.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Make the skill section look even cooler (it's nice right now but it could be better)
userPromptEntries.summary: Polished the Selected skill panel: added selected-state styling, premium background treatment, improved gauge visuals, and a structured description card while keeping the layout height stable.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Can you make the cube render at a higher fedelity
userPromptEntries.summary: Increased cube render fidelity by enabling antialiasing, raising DPR cap, increasing shadow and environment resolutions, adding EffectComposer multisampling, and smoothing cube geometry.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Can you make it a bit better please
userPromptEntries.summary: Slight extra cube quality pass: increased environment resolution, increased postprocessing multisampling, enabled Bloom mipmap blur, and added SMAA for cleaner edges.

userPromptEntries.prompt: The shine on the cube and cube color looks dulled for some reason
userPromptEntries.summary: Adjusted cube material (lower roughness, higher envMap/emissive) and tuned exposure/SSAO/Bloom so highlights and base color look less dulled.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Make the database icon look more representitive of databases
userPromptEntries.summary: Updated the database skill icon to a clearer stacked-cylinder database look in both 2D (SkillIcon) and 3D (SkillMark3D) using stronger band lines/rings.

userPromptEntries.prompt: It looks way worse now and is too big, go back and do it from scratch to make it more like a database icon
userPromptEntries.summary: Redesigned the database icon from scratch: reverted the oversized look, updated the 2D SVG to a clean classic cylinder, and rebuilt the 3D mark with a smaller stacked-cylinder silhouette and subtle band rings.

userPromptEntries.prompt: Got back to the original database icon
userPromptEntries.summary: Reverted the database icon back to the original design in both SkillIcon (2D) and SkillMark3D (3D).

userPromptEntries.prompt: On mobile when clicking an icon the entire screen flashes, remove that flash
userPromptEntries.summary: Removed mobile tap-highlight flash on the 3D canvas by disabling -webkit-tap-highlight-color and selection, and setting touch-action:none on the canvas container.

userPromptEntries.prompt: There's still a full screen blue flash when clicking the icon (on android), please remove that
userPromptEntries.summary: Further reduced Android tap feedback/flash by disabling -webkit-tap-highlight-color globally and preventing overscroll glow/scroll chaining via overscroll-behavior and touch-action on the 3D container.

userPromptEntries.prompt: On the ai prompts page on mobile the selected prompt is way at the bottom of the page, change the layout to have the scrollable prompts at the top half(ish) part of the page and have the selected prompt a the bottom(ish) half of the page
userPromptEntries.summary: Adjusted mobile Agent Prompts viewer CSS so the prompt list and prompt detail each use ~half-viewport max-heights and are independently scrollable, keeping the selected prompt visible without long scrolling.

highLevelSummary.outcome: Added agent prompt log JSON + a viewer page and instructions to keep appending.
deploymentNotes: Vite base set for GitHub Pages subpaths
Build output committed to docs/ for branch deploy
notableUX: Clickable 3D skill marks on cube faces with hover cursor and press-in animation
External HTML panel showing selected skill
In-canvas slider to control glass transmission (disables OrbitControls while dragging)
Per-face labels that appear only when a face is most camera-facing and fade smoothly
